benchmark_details.name: EmoAgent
benchmark_details.overview: EmoAgent is a multi-agent AI framework designed to evaluate and mitigate mental health hazards in human-AI interactions. It consists of EmoEval, which assesses risk of mental health deterioration in users after interactions with AI, and EmoGuard, which monitors and provides interventions to mitigate identified risks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop AI-native solutions to protect human-AI interactions and mitigate psychosocial risks in vulnerable individuals.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The study focuses on three mental health conditions (depression, delusion, psychosis) and may not address other important psychological disorders.

data.source: Simulated conversations with character-based AI agents using cognitive models based on psychiatric assessments.
data.annotation: Automatically generated simulations based on cognitive models.

methodology.calculation: The deterioration rate is calculated based on the percentage of users whose psychological test scores worsen post-interaction.
methodology.interpretation: A higher deterioration rate indicates a greater risk of psychological harm from the AI interactions.
methodology.baseline_results: Simulated deterioration rates exceed 34.4% based on character interactions.
methodology.validation: Validation conducted through controlled simulations and assessment of psychological impacts.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for inducing psychological distress in vulnerable users through engaging interactions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User simulations do not contain personal data or identifiers.
